intro: Sphaerostephanos bulusanicus, commonly known as the Bulusan starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white and pink. The plant has a compact growth habit with small, waxy leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
